result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin C Fountain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: For the Balance of Restitution and 10% Surcharge Still Owed.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $5,332.21 to be paid (jointly and severally liable) as a condition of probation as follows:  $1,035.67 to Janis G., $962.74 to Integrity Insurance, $833.80 to Daniel M., $2,500.00 to American Family Insurance.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  No contact with co-defendant.   Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC

Defendant Kevin C Fountain in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Margaret Drees, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- 4 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Restitution of $5,332.21 to be paid (jointly and severally liable) as a Condition of Probation as follows:  $1,035.67 to Janis G.; $962.74 to Integrity Insurance; $833.80 to Daniel M.; $2,500.00 to American Family Ins.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  No contact with victims.  No contact with codefendant.  

Count 2:
- 4 months Huber with standard release conditions CONSECUTIVE to Count 1. STAYED
- 1 year 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.

Count 3:
- 4 months Huber with standard release conditions CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1 and 2. STAYED
- 1 year 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
Sentencing hearing on July 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kevin C Fountain in court with attorney Stephen M Govin.  Debra L Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1, 2 and 3,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Defense requests adjourned sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kevin C Fountain in court with attorney Therese Singer for Stephen Michael Govin.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is awaiting discovery.  State provides discovery.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Kevin C Fountain in court with attorney Stephen M. Govin.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/ co-actors or their residences listed in the complaint.

Defendant Kevin C Fountain in court with attorney Stephen M Govin.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.
